name: American Near East Refugee Aid (Anera)
mission:
Since 1968, Anera has helped refugees and others hurt by conflicts in the Middle East live with dignity and purpose.
Anera, which has no political or religious affiliation, works on the ground with partners in Palestine (West Bank and Gaza), Lebanon and Jordan. We mobilize resources for immediate emergency relief and for sustainable, long-term health, education, and economic development. Our staff serve in their communities, navigating the politics that constrict progress to get help where it's needed most. That's how Anera delivered more than $100.4 million in programs in 2020 alone, and it's how we will keep building better lives until hope finds its way in the Middle East.
theoryOfChange: Anera conducts assessments to inform its program strategies, such as the 'Tech Ecosystem in Palestine' report, which was conducted to inform their career accelerator program strategy. This indicates a documented approach to how their programs create impact. Anera also states its commitment to providing impactful, sustainable programs and aligns its work with the Sustainable Development Goals. Their 'On-the-Ground Reports' detail their responses and priorities based on identified needs.
zakatClaimEvidence: Dedicated zakat page found at https://www.anera.org/zakat (Source: https://www.anera.org/zakat)

ui_signals_v1.recommendation_rationale: Strong donor fit, low risk profile, and credible supporting evidence for outcomes.

score_details.score_summary: American Near East Refugee Aid (Anera) shows exceptional alignment and good impact, with zakat compliance.

zakat.claim_evidence: Dedicated zakat page found at https://www.anera.org/zakat (Source: https://www.anera.org/zakat)

all_citations.claim: Anera holds a 100.0/100 score, a 96.3% program expense ratio, and a fundraising efficiency of $0.01 per $1 raised.
Anera is zakat-eligible and maintains a specific zakat policy for asnaf categories.
The organization reported total revenue of $173,279,297 and focuses on health, education, and economic development.
Anera recognizes significant in-kind contributions for its medical and relief programs.
Anera provides multiple giving methods to support its humanitarian mission.

baseline_narrative.amal_score_rationale: Anera achieves a strong overall score due to its perfect financial health ratings and high alignment with humanitarian needs, though its impact score is moderated by the high cost of direct service delivery.
areas_for_improvement: Relatively low working capital of 1.2 months
High cost per beneficiary relative to direct provision benchmarks

dimension_explanations.alignment: The organization shows high alignment for Muslim donors through its Zakat-eligible programs and long-standing history of serving displaced populations in the Middle East since 1968 [2][3]. Its mission focuses on urgent humanitarian needs and long-term dignity for refugees, supported by a transparent fundraising model that spends only $0.01 to raise every dollar [1][14].
dimension_explanations.impact: Anera demonstrates high operational efficiency with a program expense ratio of 96.3% and a perfect Charity Navigator rating [1]. While it provides direct provision of medical supplies and development grants, the cost per beneficiary is calculated at approximately $17,588, and the organization maintains a lean 1.2 months of working capital [1][3][13].

baseline_narrative.headline: American Near East Refugee Aid (Anera) provides critical humanitarian relief and long-term development to refugees and vulnerable communities in the Middle East.
strengths: High fundraising efficiency of $0.01 per $1 raised
Verified zakat-eligible status with clear policy guidelines
baseline_narrative.summary: founded in 1968, Anera delivers large-scale humanitarian aid through education, health, and economic development programs for those affected by conflict [1][3]. The organization is recognized for its high financial transparency and is officially zakat-eligible, adhering to specific distribution policies for eligible beneficiaries [1][2].

rich_narrative.amal_score_rationale: Anera achieves a strong overall score due to its perfect financial health ratings and high alignment with humanitarian needs, though its impact score is moderated by the high cost of direct service delivery.

areas_for_improvement.context: The organization currently maintains <cite id="16">1.2 months of working capital</cite>, which is considered lean for an organization of its scale.
Current metrics show a <cite id="17">cost of $17,588.26 per beneficiary</cite>, which is high compared to some direct provision humanitarian benchmarks.

bbb_assessment.summary: Maintains high accountability standards with audited financials and independent board oversight.

case_against.mitigation_notes: Anera's long-standing history and <cite id="3">strong revenue growth of 24.1%</cite> mitigate some liquidity risks.
risk_factors: <cite id="16">Working capital of only 1.2 months</cite> creates vulnerability to revenue volatility.
<cite id="17">High average cost per beneficiary</cite> may indicate lower breadth of impact compared to peers.
case_against.summary: The primary concerns involve <cite id="16">low liquidity reserves</cite> and a high <cite id="17">cost-per-beneficiary metric</cite>.

confidence.notes: Extremely high financial transparency and consistent third-party ratings.

alignment.explanation: Strong alignment for Muslim donors due to <cite id="10">verified zakat eligibility</cite> and a focus on <cite id="11">underserved populations in Muslim-majority regions</cite>.
alignment.improvement: Alignment could be further strengthened by <cite id="19">expanding services to additional underserved geographies</cite> with limited nonprofit coverage.

credibility.explanation: Anera is highly credible, evidenced by <cite id="9">perfect scores in Accountability, Culture, and Leadership</cite> from Charity Navigator and a <cite id="13">Platinum Seal from Candid</cite>.
credibility.improvement: To further enhance credibility, Anera could work toward increasing its <cite id="16">working capital reserves</cite> to meet standard 3-12 month benchmarks.

impact.explanation: Impact is driven by a <cite id="4">100.0% program ratio</cite> and a <cite id="18">clear theory of change</cite> focused on direct provision of aid.
impact.improvement: Impact measurement could be improved by <cite id="17">optimizing the cost-per-beneficiary ratio</cite> to increase the breadth of reach per dollar spent.

donor_fit_matrix.evidence_rigor: Grade B - Outcome tracking with clear theory of change

grantmaking_profile.grant_strategy: Distributes cash and in-kind grants to support regional development and relief.

rich_narrative.headline: American Near East Refugee Aid (Anera) provides critical humanitarian relief and long-term development to refugees and vulnerable communities in the Middle East.

ideal_donor_profile.best_for_summary: Best for donors seeking to support established, high-efficiency humanitarian relief in the Levant with zakat-eligible contributions.
donor_motivations: Want to ensure 96.3% of their donation goes toward program expenses
Prioritize aid to Palestinian refugees and vulnerable communities in Lebanon and Jordan
Value long-term institutional stability and 50+ years of regional expertise
Seek to fulfill zakat obligations through a verified and transparent process
giving_considerations: Large-scale operations mean gifts are part of a massive institutional response
The organization operates with lean financial reserves
Focus is on direct provision in high-conflict zones
ideal_donor_profile.not_ideal_for: Donors seeking small-scale, grassroots projects or those prioritizing organizations with high cash reserves.

impact_evidence.evidence_grade_explanation: Anera tracks <cite id="20">three distinct outcome metrics</cite> and maintains a <cite id="18">clear theory of change</cite>.
impact_evidence.theory_of_change_summary: Anera utilizes a direct provision model to deliver health, education, and economic aid to refugees and conflict-affected populations.
impact_evidence.why_evidence_matters: Evidence ensures that large-scale aid distributions effectively improve the dignity and purpose of refugee lives.

long_term_outlook.room_for_funding_explanation: Given the ongoing humanitarian crises in Gaza and Lebanon, Anera's capacity to absorb funding remains high.
strategic_priorities: Sustainable agriculture in the West Bank

peer_comparison.differentiator: Anera's <cite id="4">100.0% program ratio</cite> is significantly higher than the <cite id="12">peer median of 89.8%</cite>.

similar_organizations.differentiator: Similar focus on humanitarian relief and size
similar_organizations.name: Action Against Hunger USA

strengths.detail: Anera directs <cite id="4">96.3% of its expenses toward programs</cite>, significantly exceeding the <cite id="12">peer median of 89.8%</cite>.
The organization maintains a <cite id="9">100.0/100 from Charity Navigator rating</cite> and holds the <cite id="13">Candid Platinum Seal of Transparency</cite>.
Operating since <cite id="1">1968</cite>, Anera has over <cite id="14">55 years of experience</cite> navigating complex humanitarian landscapes in the Middle East.

strengths_deep_dive: Anera's strength lies in its ability to leverage large-scale institutional partnerships to maximize donor impact. By maintaining a <cite id="5">fundraising efficiency of $0.01 per $1 raised</cite>, the organization ensures that nearly every dollar of public support is translated into direct aid. This is further evidenced by their <cite id="15">96.3% independent board of directors</cite>, which provides rigorous oversight of their <cite id="3">$173.3 million annual budget</cite>.
rich_narrative.summary: Founded in <cite id="1">1968</cite> to respond to the refugee crisis following the 1967 War, American Near East Refugee Aid (Anera) has evolved into a premier humanitarian institution serving <cite id="2">Palestine, Lebanon, and Jordan</cite>. The organization operates at a significant scale, reporting <cite id="3">$173,279,297 in total revenue</cite> for the 2023 fiscal year. Anera's operational model is characterized by extreme financial efficiency, maintaining a <cite id="4">96.3% program expense ratio</cite> and a fundraising efficiency of <cite id="5">$0.01 per $1 raised</cite>. This efficiency is bolstered by a robust <cite id="6">in-kind gift distribution network</cite>, which has historically included tens of millions of dollars in <cite id="7">medical supplies and pharmaceutical aid</cite>. Beyond emergency relief, Anera implements long-term development programs in <cite id="8">agriculture, education, and community infrastructure</cite>. The organization holds a <cite id="9">perfect 100.0/100 from Charity Navigator</cite>, reflecting top-tier performance across accountability, culture, and leadership beacons. For Muslim donors, Anera provides a <cite id="10">verified zakat-eligible channel</cite> for humanitarian giving, with policies ensuring funds reach <cite id="11">eligible asnaf categories</cite> including the poor (fuqara) and needy (masakin).
